I have aspegers and have 2 kids with autism and 1 with aspergers.
I've felt like everything I do is an act. I had little to no treatment and was diagnosed later in life. I had to learn how to act from watching other people.
Small talk is still hard for me but it was impossible when I was younger. I can't look into people's eyes easily, though I found a technique where I move my focus close to their eyes but not directly has helped. Crowds bother the heck out of me, but I've found different ways to center myself so I don't get overwhelmed.
I've learned to show emotion more, especially with my kids. As I much as I have taught them to cope, they have returned tenfold on how I can express my emotions.
I've made sure that they know being on the spectrum isn't a curse or disease, it's just a part of who they are and needs to be accepted.

WRITING.TEXT:
"Of all tyrannies, a tyranny sincerely exercised for the good of its victims may be the most oppressive. It would be better to live under robber barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies. The robber baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated; but those who torment us for our own good will torment us without end for they do so with the approval of their own conscience. They may be more likely to go to Heaven yet at the same time likelier to make a Hell of earth. This very kindness stings with intolerable insult. To be "cured" against one's will and cured of states which we may not regard as disease is to be put on a level of those who have not yet reached the age of reason or those who never will; to be classed with infants, imbeciles, and domestic animals."
- C.S. Lewis

Reminds me of a story I read years ago.
Guy waited in line at a Taco Bell with a knife hidden under his clothes. He gets to front and yells loudly at the cashier, "Give me all your money!"
The robber then hears sounds of guns coming out of holsters and multiple people yelling, "Put the knife down now!"
The robber somehow missed the fact that a conference for the top Sheriffs was being held across the street, and most were in full uniform enjoying their lunch break.

WRITING.TITLE: When President Obama mentions winning let's compare him to President Bush
WRITING.TEXT:
The following numbers compare seats lost for Obama vs Bush during their presidency.
**House of Representatives**
* Bush 43
* Obama 63
**Senate**
* Bush 9
* Obama 11
**Governors**
* Bush 8
* Obama 13
**Control of State Legislature**
* Bush 4
* Obama 15
President Obama lost more seats in every level of government than President Bush. He may have won two elections, but he devastated his party while accomplishing his goal.
**Sources:** http://www.ncsl.org/Portals/1/Documents/Elections/Legis_Control_2016_Nov7.pdf http://www.ncsl.org/documents/statevote/legiscontrol_2002_2014.pdf http://www.ncsl.org/documents/statevote/legiscontrol_1990_2000.pdf https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections,_2016 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections,_2008 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections,_2000 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate_elections,_2016 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate_elections,_2008 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Senate_elections,_2000 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_gubernatorial_elections,_2016 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_gubernatorial_elections,_2008 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_gubernatorial_elections,_2000

I'm an autistic parent, possibly have aspergers myself but it's self diagnosed.
So when I get asked about it the first thing I usually mention is that it's a spectrum. Then I usually follow up how each person on the spectrum can have different traits/conditions associated with autism so it can't be easily defined.
I have three kids with autism, and I would need to define each of them separately because they each exhibit different traits.
